title: Looking for an alternative to Tarzana Wide
content:
Hi

Can anyone recomand a font similar (especially the ’R’) to Tarzana Wide Regular from Emigre? Im looking for a grotesque that is a bit more sophisticated, if I can put it like that.

[http://www.emigre.com/fontpage.php?PTarWR.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080102042458/http:/www.emigre.com/fontpage.php?PTarWR.html "http://www.emigre.com/fontpage.php?PTarWR.html")

Thanks in advance :-)

 [‹ Xuny rounded geometric sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20080102042458/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34327 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Live Free or Die onesheet casual titling sans - Coop Black {Jan Erdmann} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080102042458/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34326 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Cola Zero

comments.content: What happened to Xavier Dupre’s Spotka (distributed through T26)? I was going to recommend that but I can’t find it anywhere. It’s just disappeared.

What do you think of Fedra Sans?

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typotheque/fedra-sans/book-tf/charmap.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080102042458/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typotheque/fedra-sans/book-tf/charmap.html "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typotheque/fedra-sans/book-tf/charmap.html")

Jup, Fedra Sans looks great.

Thank you all

\> _What happened to Xavier Dupre’s Spotka (distributed through T26)? I was going to recommend that but I can’t find it anywhere. It’s just disappeared._

I recently interviewed Xavier for [Addmagazine](http://web.archive.org/web/20080102042458/http:/www.addmagazine.be/index.php/Home?nl) and he told me he retired his old T-26 stuff. He wasn’t too happy with those fonts anymore.
Well, that explains it. Thanks Yves.
